page.title: 05Blackbrook Farm
page.content:
At Blackbrook Farm Mr. Busbridge showed us some badger sets and there are 2 Barn Owls nesting in the barn. He keeps 1240 sheep, these are mainly Romneys and some Dorsets. He has a beef herd of 68 Hereford and Charolais cattle and his sheep provide meat and wool. The average size of the fields is 8 acres and their cultivation has not changed since 1670.
Mr. Busbridge has 6 Jacob's Sheep. Mrs. Busbridge uses their wool for spinning. First of all she brushes the wool with something called cards which are like flat wire brushes; these are made of leather backed onto wood through which the wires are pushed. You brush the wool until fine then you spin it into strands.
